meanings.definition: Causing the dissolution or destruction of living tissue.
meanings.sent1: The biolytic substance quickly dissolved the living tissue.
meanings.sent2: The biolytic enzyme was effective in destroying harmful bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The biolytic solution worked like a superhero, defeating the harmful living tissue.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like biolytic arrows, piercing through the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The biolytic effect of the medication was evident as the infection cleared up rapidly.

meanings.definition: Able to break down or destroy living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The biolytic chemical was powerful in breaking down the living organisms.
meanings.sent2: The biolytic properties of the cleaner helped eliminate the bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The biolytic spray danced around the germs, making them disappear like magic.
meanings.sent4: His determination was biolytic, breaking down any obstacles in his path.
meanings.sent5: The biolytic nature of the predator allowed it to easily hunt and consume its prey.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the breakdown of biological material.
meanings.sent1: The biolytic process involved in composting helps break down organic matter.
meanings.sent2: The biolytic reaction in the soil decomposes the biological material efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The biolytic bacteria in the compost bin were like tiny cleaners, breaking down the waste.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a biolytic machine, processing and breaking down complex biological concepts.
meanings.sent5: The biolytic power of nature transforms fallen leaves into rich soil for new growth.
